뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
아쉽다 = regretful (situation-focused, 'what a shame')
서운하다 = hurt/disappointed (person-focused, feeling let down by someone)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 시간이 없어서 아쉽다. / 연락도 없이 가서 서운했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: It's a shame there's no time. / I was hurt that you left without contacting me.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 아쉽다 and 서운하다: 아쉽다 = regretful (situation-focused, 'what a shame')
서운하다 = hurt/disappointed (person-focused, feeling let down by someone). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 네가 부럽다. / 친구의 성공에 질투를 느꼈다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I envy you. / I felt jealous of my friend's success.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 부럽다 and 질투하다: 부럽다 = envious (benign, admiring)
질투하다 = jealous (more negative, possessive). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

두렵다 = fearful/daunting (deeper, more abstract fear)

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 무섭다 and 두렵다: 무섭다 = scary (immediate, visceral fear)
두렵다 = fearful/daunting (deeper, more abstract fear). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

보완하다 = supplement/shore up (fill gaps)

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:

수정하다 = revise/amend (documents, plans)
보완하다 = supplement/shore up (fill gaps). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 결국 실패했다. / 마침내 정상에 도착했다. / 드디어 졸업이다!
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: In the end, it failed. / At last, we reached the summit. / Finally, graduation!
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 결국 = in the end (neutral/negative outcome)
마침내 = at last (after long effort, literary)
드디어 = finally! (excitement, long-awaited). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

오히려 = on the contrary; rather (unexpected reversal)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 이럴 바에야 차라리 안 할래. / 도와주려다가 오히려 방해가 됐다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: If it's like this, I'd rather not. / I tried to help but rather got in the way.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 차라리 and 오히려: 차라리 = rather/I'd rather (choosing lesser evil)
오히려 = on the contrary; rather (unexpected reversal). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

주장하다 = to argue / claim (an opinion or position)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 그를 후보로 내세웠다. / 자기 의견을 강하게 주장했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: They put him forward as a candidate. / He argued his opinion strongly.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 내세우다 and 주장하다: 내세우다 = to put forward / champion (a person, cause, principle)
주장하다 = to argue / claim (an opinion or position). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

분위기 = atmosphere; mood; vibe (of a place or situation)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 눈치가 빨라서 바로 알아챘다. / 분위기가 좋은 카페다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: He's perceptive so he caught on right away. / It's a cafe with a good vibe.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 눈치 and 분위기: 눈치 = social awareness; reading people (interpersonal)
분위기 = atmosphere; mood; vibe (of a place or situation). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Please refrain from drinking. / You need to restrain your emotions.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 삼가다 and 자제하다: 삼가다 = to refrain from (respectful/formal, often warnings)
자제하다 = to restrain oneself (self-control focused). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

파악하다 = to grasp/assess (analytical, factual understanding)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 남의 마음을 헤아리다. / 상황을 정확히 파악하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: To fathom someone's feelings. / To accurately grasp the situation.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 헤아리다 and 파악하다: 헤아리다 = to fathom/empathize (emotional, deeper understanding)
파악하다 = to grasp/assess (analytical, factual understanding). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 이 길은 익숙하다. / 친숙한 얼굴을 보니 반갑다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I'm used to this road. / It's nice to see a familiar face.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 익숙하다 and 친숙하다: 익숙하다 = familiar through habit/practice (skill-based)
친숙하다 = familiar in a warm/friendly way (comfort-based). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
참다 = hold back (immediate impulse — anger, tears, laughter)
견디다 = endure/withstand (prolonged hardship)

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 웃음을 참았다. / 추위를 견디다. / 인내하면 반드시 결과가 온다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I held back laughter. / Endure the cold. / If you persevere, results will come.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 참다 = hold back (immediate impulse — anger, tears, laughter)
견디다 = endure/withstand (prolonged hardship)
인내하다 = persevere with patience (formal, virtue-like). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
미루다 = put off/procrastinate (casual, often laziness)
연기하다 = postpone (official/formal, with reason)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 공부를 내일로 미뤘다. / 행사가 우천으로 연기되었다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I put off studying until tomorrow. / The event was postponed due to rain.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 미루다 and 연기하다: 미루다 = put off/procrastinate (casual, often laziness)
연기하다 = postpone (official/formal, with reason). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
탓하다 = blame (general, can be self or others)
비난하다 = criticize/condemn (stronger, public, moral judgment)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 남 탓하지 마. / 언론이 정부를 비난했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Don't blame others. / The media condemned the government.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 탓하다 and 비난하다: 탓하다 = blame (general, can be self or others)
비난하다 = criticize/condemn (stronger, public, moral judgment). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
빠지다 = fall into / get sucked in (often unintentional)

열중하다 = be engrossed/enthusiastic (active engagement)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 게임에 빠졌다. / 연구에 몰두하다. / 독서에 열중하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Got sucked into gaming. / Immersed in research. / Engrossed in reading.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 빠지다 = fall into / get sucked in (often unintentional)
몰두하다 = immerse oneself (deliberate, deep focus)
열중하다 = be engrossed/enthusiastic (active engagement). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
꺼리다 = be reluctant/hesitant about (personal discomfort)
기피하다 = avoid/shun (deliberate avoidance, stronger)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 남 앞에서 말하기를 꺼린다. / 병역을 기피하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I'm reluctant to speak in front of others. / To evade military service.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 꺼리다 and 기피하다: 꺼리다 = be reluctant/hesitant about (personal discomfort)
기피하다 = avoid/shun (deliberate avoidance, stronger). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
물러나다 = step back/withdraw (general, any context)
사퇴하다 = resign under pressure (public figures, implies scandal/failure)
사임하다 = resign (neutral/formal, voluntary)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 한 발 물러나다. / 장관이 사퇴했다. / 건강상의 이유로 사임했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Step back one pace. / The minister resigned (under pressure). / Resigned for health reasons.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 물러나다 = step back/withdraw (general, any context)
사퇴하다 = resign under pressure (public figures, implies scandal/failure)
사임하다 = resign (neutral/formal, voluntary). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
따지다 = question/nitpick (confrontational, demanding accountability)
캐묻다 = pry/dig into (nosy, invasive questioning)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 잘잘못을 따지다. / 사생활을 캐묻다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: To question who's right and wrong. / To pry into someone's private life.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 따지다 and 캐묻다: 따지다 = question/nitpick (confrontational, demanding accountability)
캐묻다 = pry/dig into (nosy, invasive questioning). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
시달리다 = be plagued/tormented (ongoing, wearing you down)
시련을 겪다 = go through a trial/ordeal (discrete event, builds character)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 불면증에 시달리다. / 큰 시련을 겪고 성장했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: To be plagued by insomnia. / Grew through a great ordeal.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 시달리다 and 시련을 겪다: 시달리다 = be plagued/tormented (ongoing, wearing you down)
시련을 겪다 = go through a trial/ordeal (discrete event, builds character). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
그르치다 = to spoil/ruin (lead astray, esp. a person's path)
망치다 = to mess up/wreck (broader, any situation)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 아이의 교육을 그르치다. / 발표를 완전히 망쳤다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: To ruin a child's upbringing. / Completely messed up the presentation.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 그르치다 and 망치다: 그르치다 = to spoil/ruin (lead astray, esp. a person's path)
망치다 = to mess up/wreck (broader, any situation). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
바라다 = hope/wish (warm, personal, often for others)
원하다 = want (direct, personal desire)
희망하다 = hope for (formal, often for larger outcomes)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 행복하길 바란다. / 나는 자유를 원한다. / 평화를 희망합니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I hope you're happy. / I want freedom. / We hope for peace.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 바라다 = hope/wish (warm, personal, often for others)
원하다 = want (direct, personal desire)
희망하다 = hope for (formal, often for larger outcomes). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

공개하다 = disclose/make public (reveal what was hidden)
발표하다 = announce/present (official, to an audience)

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Informed my parents of the news. / Disclosed investigation results. / Presented research findings.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 알리다 = let someone know/inform (personal, direct)
공개하다 = disclose/make public (reveal what was hidden)
발표하다 = announce/present (official, to an audience). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

마음이 끌리다 = to be drawn to (attraction, pulled toward something)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 오늘은 운동이 내키지 않는다. / 그 사람한테 마음이 끌린다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I don't feel like exercising today. / I'm drawn to that person.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 내키다 and 마음이 끌리다: 내키다 = to feel like it (motivation/willingness from within)
마음이 끌리다 = to be drawn to (attraction, pulled toward something). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

치장하다 = to dress up/adorn (specifically appearance, often excessive)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 방을 예쁘게 꾸몄다. / 화려하게 치장하고 나타났다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Decorated the room prettily. / Showed up dressed to the nines.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 꾸미다 and 치장하다: 꾸미다 = to decorate/make up (general — room, appearance, story)
치장하다 = to dress up/adorn (specifically appearance, often excessive). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

지나치다 = excessive/going too far (crossing a line)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 감기가 심하다. / 농담이 지나쳤다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The cold is severe. / The joke went too far.

Compare 심하다 and 지나치다: 심하다 = severe/extreme (degree of intensity)
지나치다 = excessive/going too far (crossing a line). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
돕다 = help (general, sincere assistance)
거들다 = lend a hand / pitch in (lighter, supplementary help — sometimes implies doing the easy part)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 이사할 때 친구가 도와줬다. / 거들기만 하고 힘든 건 안 했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: My friend helped me move. / He only pitched in a little and didn't do the hard part.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 돕다 and 거들다: 돕다 = help (general, sincere assistance)
거들다 = lend a hand / pitch in (lighter, supplementary help — sometimes implies doing the easy part). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
아끼다 = to cherish / save (emotional + practical — treasuring or being frugal)
절약하다 = to economize / save (purely practical, resource-focused)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 이 인형은 어릴 때부터 아끼던 거야. / 전기를 절약합시다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I've treasured this doll since childhood. / Let's save electricity.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 아끼다 and 절약하다: 아끼다 = to cherish / save (emotional + practical — treasuring or being frugal)
절약하다 = to economize / save (purely practical, resource-focused). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
얕보다 = underestimate; look down on (judging ability as low)
무시하다 = ignore / disregard (broader: either dismissing or snubbing)
업신여기다 = despise; treat with contempt (strongest, demeaning someone's worth)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 상대를 얕봤다가 졌다. / 내 의견을 무시했다. / 가난하다고 업신여기면 안 된다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I underestimated my opponent and lost. / They ignored my opinion. / You shouldn't despise someone for being poor.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 얕보다 = underestimate; look down on (judging ability as low)
무시하다 = ignore / disregard (broader: either dismissing or snubbing)
업신여기다 = despise; treat with contempt (strongest, demeaning someone's worth). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
부추기다 = to egg on / instigate (negative: encouraging bad behavior)
독려하다 = to encourage / urge on (positive: motivating toward good)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 친구가 싸움을 부추겼다. / 선생님이 학생들을 독려했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: My friend egged on the fight. / The teacher encouraged the students.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 부추기다 and 독려하다: 부추기다 = to egg on / instigate (negative: encouraging bad behavior)
독려하다 = to encourage / urge on (positive: motivating toward good). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
풀다 = to untie/solve (physical or abstract: knots, problems, misunderstandings)
해결하다 = to resolve/solve (formal, structured problems)
해소하다 = to relieve/dissolve (abstract tensions, stress, doubts)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 오해를 풀었다. / 문제를 해결했다. / 스트레스를 해소했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Cleared up the misunderstanding. / Resolved the problem. / Relieved the stress.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 풀다 = to untie/solve (physical or abstract: knots, problems, misunderstandings)
해결하다 = to resolve/solve (formal, structured problems)
해소하다 = to relieve/dissolve (abstract tensions, stress, doubts). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
떠맡다 = to get stuck with / take on reluctantly (burden, unwanted task)
담당하다 = to be in charge of (neutral/official responsibility)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 아무도 안 하려는 일을 내가 떠맡았다. / 마케팅을 담당하고 있습니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I got stuck with the work nobody wanted. / I'm in charge of marketing.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 떠맡다 and 담당하다: 떠맡다 = to get stuck with / take on reluctantly (burden, unwanted task)
담당하다 = to be in charge of (neutral/official responsibility). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
사그라지다 = to die down / fade away (flames, passion, anger — gradual extinction)
가라앉다 = to sink / calm down (settling, like sediment or emotions subsiding)
잦아들다 = to subside / quiet down (noise, rain, commotion diminishing)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 분노가 서서히 사그라졌다. / 흥분이 가라앉았다. / 빗소리가 잦아들었다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The anger gradually died down. / The excitement subsided. / The sound of rain quieted.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 사그라지다 = to die down / fade away (flames, passion, anger — gradual extinction)
가라앉다 = to sink / calm down (settling, like sediment or emotions subsiding)
잦아들다 = to subside / quiet down (noise, rain, commotion diminishing). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
다그치다 = to press/pressure someone (aggressive, cornering — often with questions)
재촉하다 = to urge/hurry someone (impatient but less hostile — wanting speed)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 형사가 용의자를 다그쳤다. / 편집장이 마감을 재촉했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The detective pressed the suspect. / The editor urged the deadline.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 다그치다 and 재촉하다: 다그치다 = to press/pressure someone (aggressive, cornering — often with questions)
재촉하다 = to urge/hurry someone (impatient but less hostile — wanting speed). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
낡다 = worn out / shabby (physical deterioration, negative)
오래되다 = old / long-standing (neutral, just time)
노후하다 = aged / decrepit (formal, infrastructure/facilities degraded)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 옷이 낡아서 버렸다. / 오래된 전통이다. / 노후한 시설을 교체해야 한다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The clothes were worn out so I threw them away. / It's a long-standing tradition. / Decrepit facilities must be replaced.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 낡다 = worn out / shabby (physical deterioration, negative)
오래되다 = old / long-standing (neutral, just time)
노후하다 = aged / decrepit (formal, infrastructure/facilities degraded). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
빌다 = to beg / pray / wish (informal, personal — can also mean beg for mercy)
기원하다 = to wish for / pray for (formal, ceremonial — success, peace)
기도하다 = to pray (religious, spiritual practice)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 합격을 빌었다. / 세계 평화를 기원합니다. / 매일 아침 기도한다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I wished/prayed for passing. / We pray for world peace. / I pray every morning.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 빌다 = to beg / pray / wish (informal, personal — can also mean beg for mercy)
기원하다 = to wish for / pray for (formal, ceremonial — success, peace)
기도하다 = to pray (religious, spiritual practice). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
넘기다 = to turn/pass over (pages, tasks to others, deadlines — versatile)
건너뛰다 = to skip over (physically or in sequence)
생략하다 = to omit (formal, deliberately leaving out content)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 페이지를 넘기다. / 아침을 건너뛰었다. / 세부 사항은 생략하겠습니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Turn the page. / I skipped breakfast. / I will omit the details.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 넘기다 = to turn/pass over (pages, tasks to others, deadlines — versatile)
건너뛰다 = to skip over (physically or in sequence)
생략하다 = to omit (formal, deliberately leaving out content). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
늘어나다 = to stretch / increase (physical or quantity, native Korean)
증가하다 = to increase (statistical, formal, Sino-Korean)
불어나다 = to swell / balloon (growing uncontrollably — debt, numbers, rivers)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 줄이 늘어났다. / 인구가 증가했다. / 빚이 불어났다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The line stretched. / The population increased. / The debt ballooned.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 늘어나다 = to stretch / increase (physical or quantity, native Korean)
증가하다 = to increase (statistical, formal, Sino-Korean)
불어나다 = to swell / balloon (growing uncontrollably — debt, numbers, rivers). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
억울하다 = to feel wronged / unjustly treated (external injustice done to you)
분하다 = to feel indignant / frustrated (internal burning — you want to fight back)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 도둑으로 몰려서 억울했다. / 지는 것이 분했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I felt wronged being accused of stealing. / Losing was infuriating.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 억울하다 and 분하다: 억울하다 = to feel wronged / unjustly treated (external injustice done to you)
분하다 = to feel indignant / frustrated (internal burning — you want to fight back). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
튀다 = to stand out / stick out (can be negative — gaudy, weird)
눈에 띄다 = to catch the eye / be noticeable (neutral to positive)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 혼자 너무 튀는 옷을 입었다. / 성적이 눈에 띄게 올랐다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: He wore clothes that stuck out too much. / Grades improved noticeably.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 튀다 and 눈에 띄다: 튀다 = to stand out / stick out (can be negative — gaudy, weird)
눈에 띄다 = to catch the eye / be noticeable (neutral to positive). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
서투르다 = unskilled / clumsy at (lack of practice — can be endearing)
미숙하다 = immature / inexperienced (formal, developmental stage)
어설프다 = half-baked / sloppy (negative — poorly done, not thorough)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 요리에 서투르다. / 아직 사회적으로 미숙하다. / 어설픈 거짓말은 금방 들통난다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I'm clumsy at cooking. / Still socially immature. / A sloppy lie gets exposed right away.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 서투르다 = unskilled / clumsy at (lack of practice — can be endearing)
미숙하다 = immature / inexperienced (formal, developmental stage)
어설프다 = half-baked / sloppy (negative — poorly done, not thorough). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
막히다 = to be blocked / stuck (traffic, pipes, conversation — concrete)
정체되다 = to stagnate / be congested (formal, prolonged standstill)
답답하다 = to feel stuffy / frustrated (physical stuffiness or emotional frustration)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 길이 막혀서 늦었다. / 경제가 정체되어 있다. / 말이 안 통해서 답답하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I was late because traffic was blocked. / The economy has stagnated. / I'm frustrated because we can't communicate.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 막히다 = to be blocked / stuck (traffic, pipes, conversation — concrete)
정체되다 = to stagnate / be congested (formal, prolonged standstill)
답답하다 = to feel stuffy / frustrated (physical stuffiness or emotional frustration). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
가다듬다 = to compose / steady oneself (collecting thoughts, voice, emotions before acting)
추스르다 = to pull oneself together (recovering from shock, grief, or collapse)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 마음을 가다듬고 발표를 시작했다. / 슬픔을 추스르고 일어섰다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I composed myself and began the presentation. / I pulled myself together from grief and stood up.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 가다듬다 and 추스르다: 가다듬다 = to compose / steady oneself (collecting thoughts, voice, emotions before acting)
추스르다 = to pull oneself together (recovering from shock, grief, or collapse). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
흐릿하다 = blurry / hazy (vision, images — out of focus)
희미하다 = faint / dim (light, sound, memory — barely perceptible)
어렴풋하다 = vague / faintly (memory or impression — slightly recalled)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 안경 없이는 흐릿하게 보인다. / 희미한 불빛이 보였다. / 어렴풋이 기억이 난다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Without glasses, things look blurry. / A faint light was visible. / I vaguely remember.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 흐릿하다 = blurry / hazy (vision, images — out of focus)
희미하다 = faint / dim (light, sound, memory — barely perceptible)
어렴풋하다 = vague / faintly (memory or impression — slightly recalled). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
해내다 = to pull off / manage to do (overcoming difficulty, personal effort)
이루다 = to achieve / fulfill (dreams, goals — emotionally resonant)
달성하다 = to attain / achieve (targets, quotas — formal/measurable)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 결국 해냈다! / 꿈을 이루다. / 목표를 달성했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I finally pulled it off! / To fulfill a dream. / Achieved the target.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 해내다 = to pull off / manage to do (overcoming difficulty, personal effort)
이루다 = to achieve / fulfill (dreams, goals — emotionally resonant)
달성하다 = to attain / achieve (targets, quotas — formal/measurable). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
지겹다 = tedious / sick of (weary from repetition or boredom)
싫증나다 = to grow tired of / lose interest (interest fading over time)
질리다 = to be fed up / have had enough (often with food or experiences — saturation)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 매일 같은 일이 지겹다. / 취미에 싫증이 났다. / 라면은 이제 질렸다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The same work every day is tedious. / I grew tired of my hobby. / I'm fed up with ramen.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 지겹다 = tedious / sick of (weary from repetition or boredom)
싫증나다 = to grow tired of / lose interest (interest fading over time)
질리다 = to be fed up / have had enough (often with food or experiences — saturation). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
쓸쓸하다 = desolate / bleak (atmosphere, scenery — melancholic emptiness)
외롭다 = lonely (emotional, wanting companionship)
고독하다 = solitary / in solitude (literary, can be dignified or philosophical)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 가을 바람이 쓸쓸하다. / 혼자 살아서 외롭다. / 고독한 예술가의 삶.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The autumn wind feels desolate. / Living alone, I'm lonely. / The solitary life of an artist.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 쓸쓸하다 = desolate / bleak (atmosphere, scenery — melancholic emptiness)
외롭다 = lonely (emotional, wanting companionship)
고독하다 = solitary / in solitude (literary, can be dignified or philosophical). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
거절하다 = to decline / turn down (general refusal of offers, requests)
사양하다 = to politely decline (humble, deferring — 'I couldn't possibly')
거부하다 = to refuse / reject (strong, assertive — sometimes defiant)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 초대를 거절했다. / 선물은 사양하겠습니다. / 부당한 요구를 거부했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I declined the invitation. / I must politely decline the gift. / I refused the unfair demand.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 거절하다 = to decline / turn down (general refusal of offers, requests)
사양하다 = to politely decline (humble, deferring — 'I couldn't possibly')
거부하다 = to refuse / reject (strong, assertive — sometimes defiant). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
버릇 = habit (often bad, personal quirk — native Korean)
습관 = habit (neutral, regular pattern — Sino-Korean)
습성 = behavioral trait / nature (innate tendency of animals or people)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 손톱 물어뜯는 버릇이 있다. / 운동하는 습관을 들이자. / 고양이의 야행성 습성.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I have a habit of biting my nails. / Let's build a habit of exercising. / A cat's nocturnal nature.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 버릇 = habit (often bad, personal quirk — native Korean)
습관 = habit (neutral, regular pattern — Sino-Korean)
습성 = behavioral trait / nature (innate tendency of animals or people). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
어쩐지 = no wonder / so that's why (realizing the reason after the fact)
왠지 = for some reason / somehow (unexplained feeling)
아무래도 = no matter how I think about it / it seems like (leaning toward a conclusion)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 어쩐지 오늘 조용하더라니 다들 외출했구나. / 왠지 불안한 느낌이 든다. / 아무래도 직접 가 봐야 할 것 같다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: No wonder it was quiet today — everyone went out. / For some reason I feel uneasy. / No matter how I think about it, I should go in person.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 어쩐지 = no wonder / so that's why (realizing the reason after the fact)
왠지 = for some reason / somehow (unexplained feeling)
아무래도 = no matter how I think about it / it seems like (leaning toward a conclusion). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
뉘우치다 = to repent / feel remorse (deep moral awakening, literary)
반성하다 = to reflect on one's actions / self-criticize (practical, often requested by others)
후회하다 = to regret (wishing you hadn't done something — personal)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 잘못을 뉘우치고 새 사람이 되었다. / 자신의 행동을 반성해라. / 그때 떠나지 않은 것을 후회한다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: He repented his wrongs and became a new person. / Reflect on your behavior. / I regret not leaving then.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 뉘우치다 = to repent / feel remorse (deep moral awakening, literary)
반성하다 = to reflect on one's actions / self-criticize (practical, often requested by others)
후회하다 = to regret (wishing you hadn't done something — personal). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
그립다 = to miss / long for (deep, nostalgic yearning — places, times, people gone)
보고 싶다 = to miss / want to see (direct, personal — actively wanting reunion)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 고향이 그립다. / 엄마가 보고 싶다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I miss my hometown. / I miss my mom (I want to see her).
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 그립다 and 보고 싶다: 그립다 = to miss / long for (deep, nostalgic yearning — places, times, people gone)
보고 싶다 = to miss / want to see (direct, personal — actively wanting reunion). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
섭섭하다 = disappointed / a bit hurt (by someone's actions or parting — interpersonal)
허전하다 = feeling empty / something's missing (a void left behind — situational)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 인사도 없이 가서 섭섭했다. / 그가 떠나니 마음이 허전하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I was hurt that you left without saying goodbye. / With him gone, I feel empty.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 섭섭하다 and 허전하다: 섭섭하다 = disappointed / a bit hurt (by someone's actions or parting — interpersonal)
허전하다 = feeling empty / something's missing (a void left behind — situational). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
짜증나다 = annoyed / irritated (minor, repetitive triggers)
화나다 = angry (general anger, clear cause)
성나다 = angered / wrathful (literary/formal, stronger indignation)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 모기 때문에 짜증난다. / 거짓말을 듣고 화가 났다. / 불의를 보고 성이 났다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Mosquitoes are annoying me. / I got angry hearing the lie. / I was angered seeing injustice.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 짜증나다 = annoyed / irritated (minor, repetitive triggers)
화나다 = angry (general anger, clear cause)
성나다 = angered / wrathful (literary/formal, stronger indignation). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
설레다 = to flutter / feel butterflies (romantic, hopeful anticipation)
흥분하다 = to be excited / agitated (intense arousal — positive or negative, can imply losing composure)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 첫 데이트라 설렌다. / 골이 들어가자 관중이 흥분했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I have butterflies because it's my first date. / The crowd got excited when the goal went in.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 설레다 and 흥분하다: 설레다 = to flutter / feel butterflies (romantic, hopeful anticipation)
흥분하다 = to be excited / agitated (intense arousal — positive or negative, can imply losing composure). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
안타깝다 = regrettable / heartbreaking (empathy for someone's unfortunate situation)
가엾다 = pitiable (literary, compassionate sorrow for the weak)
불쌍하다 = pitiful / poor thing (common, can sound condescending)

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
간절하다 = earnest / desperate (emotional longing — heartfelt wish or plea)
절실하다 = urgent / keenly felt (practical necessity — something desperately needed)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 간절히 기도했다. / 개혁이 절실하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Prayed earnestly. / Reform is urgently needed.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 간절하다 and 절실하다: 간절하다 = earnest / desperate (emotional longing — heartfelt wish or plea)
절실하다 = urgent / keenly felt (practical necessity — something desperately needed). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
처량하다 = forlorn / desolate (pitifully lonely — evoking sadness in the observer)
비참하다 = miserable / wretched (extreme suffering or degradation — objectively terrible condition)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 혼자 떠도는 모습이 처량하다. / 전쟁 후 비참한 생활이 이어졌다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Wandering alone looks forlorn. / Miserable living conditions continued after the war.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 처량하다 and 비참하다: 처량하다 = forlorn / desolate (pitifully lonely — evoking sadness in the observer)
비참하다 = miserable / wretched (extreme suffering or degradation — objectively terrible condition). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
과감하다 = bold / decisive (taking decisive action without hesitation — cutting losses, making changes)
대담하다 = daring / audacious (fearless in the face of danger or convention — can border on reckless)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 과감하게 사업을 정리했다. / 대담한 도전에 사람들이 놀랐다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Boldly liquidated the business. / People were amazed by the daring challenge.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 과감하다 and 대담하다: 과감하다 = bold / decisive (taking decisive action without hesitation — cutting losses, making changes)
대담하다 = daring / audacious (fearless in the face of danger or convention — can border on reckless). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
한심하다 = pathetic / pitiful (contempt for someone's incompetence or behavior)
어이없다 = absurd / dumbfounded (so ridiculous you're at a loss for words)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 이 나이에 이런 짓을 하다니 한심하다. / 어이가 없어서 말이 안 나온다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Doing this at your age is pathetic. / So absurd I'm speechless.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 한심하다 and 어이없다: 한심하다 = pathetic / pitiful (contempt for someone's incompetence or behavior)
어이없다 = absurd / dumbfounded (so ridiculous you're at a loss for words). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
뻔뻔하다 = shameless / brazen (acting as if nothing is wrong despite wrongdoing — thick-skinned)
염치없다 = having no sense of shame / imposing (knowing it's wrong but doing it anyway — often used self-deprecatingly)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 거짓말하고도 뻔뻔하게 웃는다. / 염치없지만 한 번만 더 부탁드려도 될까요?
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Lies and then smiles shamelessly. / I know it's shameless, but may I ask one more favor?
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 뻔뻔하다 and 염치없다: 뻔뻔하다 = shameless / brazen (acting as if nothing is wrong despite wrongdoing — thick-skinned)
염치없다 = having no sense of shame / imposing (knowing it's wrong but doing it anyway — often used self-deprecatingly). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
찜찜하다 = uneasy / unsettled (a nagging discomfort — something doesn't sit right)
께름칙하다 = bothered / uncomfortable (moral or social unease — something on your conscience)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 뭔가 찜찜한 느낌이 든다. / 거절한 것이 자꾸 께름칙하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I have an uneasy feeling about something. / I keep feeling bothered about having refused.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 찜찜하다 and 께름칙하다: 찜찜하다 = uneasy / unsettled (a nagging discomfort — something doesn't sit right)
께름칙하다 = bothered / uncomfortable (moral or social unease — something on your conscience). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
야무지다 = capable / solid (a person who is competent and no-nonsense — practical strength)
알차다 = substantial / fruitful (content or results that are packed with value — well-organized, productive)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 야무진 성격이라 뭐든 잘 해낸다. / 알찬 내용으로 가득한 강의였다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: She's so capable that she handles everything well. / It was a lecture packed with substantial content.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 야무지다 and 알차다: 야무지다 = capable / solid (a person who is competent and no-nonsense — practical strength)
알차다 = substantial / fruitful (content or results that are packed with value — well-organized, productive). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
소홀하다 = negligent / careless (not paying enough attention — often unintentional)
등한시하다 = to neglect / disregard (deliberately deprioritizing something important)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 건강 관리에 소홀했다. / 교육 문제를 등한시하면 안 된다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I was negligent about health management. / We must not neglect education issues.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 소홀하다 and 등한시하다: 소홀하다 = negligent / careless (not paying enough attention — often unintentional)
등한시하다 = to neglect / disregard (deliberately deprioritizing something important). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
유난스럽다 = fussy / over-the-top (making a big deal, being dramatic — mildly negative)
별나다 = eccentric / peculiar (unusual personality or behavior — can be charming or strange)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 유난 떨지 마. / 별난 취미를 가진 사람이다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Stop making such a fuss. / He's a person with eccentric hobbies.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 유난스럽다 and 별나다: 유난스럽다 = fussy / over-the-top (making a big deal, being dramatic — mildly negative)
별나다 = eccentric / peculiar (unusual personality or behavior — can be charming or strange). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
느닷없다 = abrupt / out of nowhere (completely without warning — shocking and unexpected)
갑작스럽다 = sudden (happening quickly without preparation — can be surprising but slightly more natural)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 느닷없이 소리를 질러서 놀랐다. / 갑작스러운 방문에 당황했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I was startled by the abrupt shouting. / Flustered by the sudden visit.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 느닷없다 and 갑작스럽다: 느닷없다 = abrupt / out of nowhere (completely without warning — shocking and unexpected)
갑작스럽다 = sudden (happening quickly without preparation — can be surprising but slightly more natural). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
허술하다 = flimsy / lax (security, defenses, or work that has exploitable gaps)
엉성하다 = shoddy / loosely put together (construction, plans, or work that is poorly done — slipshod)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 경비가 허술해서 도둑이 들었다. / 엉성하게 만들어서 금방 부서졌다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The security was so lax that a thief got in. / It was shoddily made, so it broke right away.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 허술하다 and 엉성하다: 허술하다 = flimsy / lax (security, defenses, or work that has exploitable gaps)
엉성하다 = shoddy / loosely put together (construction, plans, or work that is poorly done — slipshod). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
빡빡하다 = tight / rigid (schedule, regulations, or budget with zero flexibility)
촉박하다 = pressed for time / running short (urgency — deadline approaching fast)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 일정이 빡빡해서 쉴 틈이 없다. / 시간이 촉박하니 서두르자.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The schedule is so tight there's no time to rest. / Time is running short, so let's hurry.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 빡빡하다 and 촉박하다: 빡빡하다 = tight / rigid (schedule, regulations, or budget with zero flexibility)
촉박하다 = pressed for time / running short (urgency — deadline approaching fast). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
후련하다 = relieved / a weight lifted (emotional release — after confessing, finishing something stressful)
개운하다 = refreshed / clear (physical or mental freshness — after a bath, sleep, or resolving something cleanly)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 말하고 나니 후련하다. / 샤워하고 나니 개운하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I feel relieved after saying it. / I feel refreshed after showering.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 후련하다 and 개운하다: 후련하다 = relieved / a weight lifted (emotional release — after confessing, finishing something stressful)
개운하다 = refreshed / clear (physical or mental freshness — after a bath, sleep, or resolving something cleanly). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
가까스로 = barely / by a hair's breadth (dramatic close call — narrowly avoiding disaster)
겨우 = barely / only just (minimal, with difficulty — can also mean 'only' in dismissive sense)
간신히 = narrowly / with great difficulty (sustained struggle to just manage)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 가까스로 사고를 피했다. / 겨우 시간에 맞췄다. / 간신히 합격했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Barely avoided the accident. / Just barely made it on time. / Narrowly passed.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 가까스로 = barely / by a hair's breadth (dramatic close call — narrowly avoiding disaster)
겨우 = barely / only just (minimal, with difficulty — can also mean 'only' in dismissive sense)
간신히 = narrowly / with great difficulty (sustained struggle to just manage). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
대충 = roughly / half-heartedly (carelessly, without effort — negative connotation)
대략 = approximately / roughly (neutral estimate — numbers, outlines)
얼추 = more or less / pretty much (colloquial, close enough to count)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 대충 하지 말고 제대로 해. / 대략 50명 정도 왔다. / 얼추 비슷하네.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Don't do it half-heartedly, do it properly. / Approximately 50 people came. / That's more or less the same.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 대충 = roughly / half-heartedly (carelessly, without effort — negative connotation)
대략 = approximately / roughly (neutral estimate — numbers, outlines)
얼추 = more or less / pretty much (colloquial, close enough to count). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
기어이 = stubbornly / at all costs (determined to do something no matter what — willful persistence)
끝내 = in the end / ultimately (after everything, the final outcome — can be positive or negative)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 기어이 해내고야 말겠다. / 끝내 화해하지 못했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I will do it at all costs. / In the end, they couldn't reconcile.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 기어이 and 끝내: 기어이 = stubbornly / at all costs (determined to do something no matter what — willful persistence)
끝내 = in the end / ultimately (after everything, the final outcome — can be positive or negative). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
잔뜩 = fully / a ton (loaded up, often with negative nuance — tension, anger, clouds piling up)
가득 = full / filled (neutral, brimming — containers, rooms, hearts)
한껏 = to the fullest / to one's heart's content (positive, maximizing — effort, enjoyment)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 하늘에 먹구름이 잔뜩 끼었다. / 방에 사람이 가득 찼다. / 한껏 즐기세요.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The sky was loaded with dark clouds. / The room was filled with people. / Enjoy to the fullest.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 잔뜩 = fully / a ton (loaded up, often with negative nuance — tension, anger, clouds piling up)
가득 = full / filled (neutral, brimming — containers, rooms, hearts)
한껏 = to the fullest / to one's heart's content (positive, maximizing — effort, enjoyment). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
슬며시 = stealthily / slyly (quietly and secretly — a single smooth action)
살짝 = slightly / just a little (light, gentle touch or movement — also 'secretly' in casual speech)
살금살금 = on tiptoe / sneakily (repeated quiet footsteps — creeping movement)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 슬며시 빠져나왔다. / 살짝 만져 봤다. / 살금살금 다가갔다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Slipped away stealthily. / Touched it lightly. / Crept up on tiptoe.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 슬며시 = stealthily / slyly (quietly and secretly — a single smooth action)
살짝 = slightly / just a little (light, gentle touch or movement — also 'secretly' in casual speech)
살금살금 = on tiptoe / sneakily (repeated quiet footsteps — creeping movement). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
곧잘 = quite often / rather well (frequent occurrence, sometimes implying surprising competence or a recurring tendency)
종종 = sometimes / from time to time (occasional, less frequent than 곧잘)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 아이가 곧잘 어른 흉내를 낸다. / 종종 그 카페에 간다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The child quite often imitates adults. / I go to that cafe from time to time.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 곧잘 and 종종: 곧잘 = quite often / rather well (frequent occurrence, sometimes implying surprising competence or a recurring tendency)
종종 = sometimes / from time to time (occasional, less frequent than 곧잘). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
섣불리 = rashly / prematurely (acting before thinking it through — hasty judgment)
함부로 = recklessly / carelessly (without regard for consequences or propriety — disrespectful)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 섣불리 판단하지 마라. / 남의 물건을 함부로 만지지 마.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Don't judge rashly. / Don't touch other people's things carelessly.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 섣불리 and 함부로: 섣불리 = rashly / prematurely (acting before thinking it through — hasty judgment)
함부로 = recklessly / carelessly (without regard for consequences or propriety — disrespectful). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
도대체 = on earth / what the hell (frustrated emphasis in questions — stronger)
대체 = what on earth (same as 도대체 but slightly softer)
과연 = indeed / as expected (confirming a suspicion or expressing wonder — 'I wonder if...')
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 도대체 뭘 원하는 거야? / 대체 어디 간 거야? / 과연 그럴까?
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: What on earth do you want? / Where on earth did you go? / Is that really so, I wonder?
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 도대체 = on earth / what the hell (frustrated emphasis in questions — stronger)
대체 = what on earth (same as 도대체 but slightly softer)
과연 = indeed / as expected (confirming a suspicion or expressing wonder — 'I wonder if...'). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
고작 = merely / at most (dismissively small — 'is that all?')
기껏 = at best / after all that effort (disappointment that effort led to little — 'all for nothing')
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 고작 이거밖에 못 했어? / 기껏 준비했더니 취소됐다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Is this all you managed? / I prepared so hard, and it got canceled.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 고작 and 기껏: 고작 = merely / at most (dismissively small — 'is that all?')
기껏 = at best / after all that effort (disappointment that effort led to little — 'all for nothing'). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
마냥 = endlessly / just like (sitting around doing nothing; or 'as if' — passive, unconcerned)
한없이 = endlessly / boundlessly (infinite in degree — emotion, time, space — literary)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 마냥 기다릴 수만은 없다. / 한없이 넓은 바다를 바라봤다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I can't just keep waiting forever. / Gazed at the endlessly vast sea.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 마냥 and 한없이: 마냥 = endlessly / just like (sitting around doing nothing; or 'as if' — passive, unconcerned)
한없이 = endlessly / boundlessly (infinite in degree — emotion, time, space — literary). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
무작정 = blindly / without a plan (acting on impulse without preparation)
덮어놓고 = unconditionally / blindly (accepting or doing without questioning — 'no matter what')
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 무작정 서울로 올라왔다. / 덮어놓고 믿으면 안 된다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Came up to Seoul with no plan. / You can't just blindly trust everything.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 무작정 and 덮어놓고: 무작정 = blindly / without a plan (acting on impulse without preparation)
덮어놓고 = unconditionally / blindly (accepting or doing without questioning — 'no matter what'). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
가만히 = still / motionless (not moving or not intervening — 'stay put')
조용히 = quietly (low noise, doing something without drawing attention)
잠자코 = silently / without a word (keeping mouth shut — enduring or observing without speaking)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 가만히 있어. / 조용히 문을 닫았다. / 잠자코 듣고만 있었다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Stay still. / Closed the door quietly. / Just listened silently without a word.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 가만히 = still / motionless (not moving or not intervening — 'stay put')
조용히 = quietly (low noise, doing something without drawing attention)
잠자코 = silently / without a word (keeping mouth shut — enduring or observing without speaking). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
비로소 = only then / not until (literary, marking the first time something becomes true — a turning point)
이제야 = only now / finally (colloquial, emphasizing lateness — 'it took this long')
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 직접 겪고 나서야 비로소 알게 되었다. / 이제야 이해가 된다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Only after experiencing it firsthand did I finally understand. / Only now do I understand.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 비로소 and 이제야: 비로소 = only then / not until (literary, marking the first time something becomes true — a turning point)
이제야 = only now / finally (colloquial, emphasizing lateness — 'it took this long'). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
하필 = of all times/things (frustrated coincidence — 'why now? why this?')
공교롭게 = coincidentally / as fate would have it (unfortunate coincidence — more formal, less emotional)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 하필 오늘 비가 오다니. / 공교롭게도 같은 날 약속이 겹쳤다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Of all days, it had to rain today. / Coincidentally, plans overlapped on the same day.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 하필 and 공교롭게: 하필 = of all times/things (frustrated coincidence — 'why now? why this?')
공교롭게 = coincidentally / as fate would have it (unfortunate coincidence — more formal, less emotional). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

단서 = clue / lead (a piece of information that helps solve a mystery or problem). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

형편 = circumstances / means (practical situation, especially financial — how things stand). Use in appropriate register.

능력 = ability / talent (general capacity to do something — broadest term). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

행실 = conduct / behavior (pattern of moral behavior over time — character judgment). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

적대감 = hostility (active antagonism — wanting to oppose or fight someone). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

선입견 = preconception (pre-formed opinion before knowing the facts — first impression bias)

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:

고정관념 = stereotype / fixed idea (rigid, generalized belief about a group or concept — hard to change). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
집 = house/home (plain)
댁 = home/residence (honorific — referring to someone else's home respectfully, or addressing someone)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 우리 집에 놀러 와. / 댁이 어디세요?
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Come hang out at my place. / Where is your home? (respectful)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 집 and 댁: 집 = house/home (plain)
댁 = home/residence (honorific — referring to someone else's home respectfully, or addressing someone). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
이름 = name (plain)
성함 = name (honorific — when asking or referring to a superior's or elder's name)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 이름이 뭐예요? / 성함이 어떻게 되세요?
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: What's your name? (casual) / May I ask your name? (respectful)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 이름 and 성함: 이름 = name (plain)
성함 = name (honorific — when asking or referring to a superior's or elder's name). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
생일 = birthday (plain)
생신 = birthday (honorific — used for parents, grandparents, elders)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 친구 생일 파티에 갔다. / 아버지 생신을 축하드립니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I went to a friend's birthday party. / Happy birthday, Father. (respectful)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 생일 and 생신: 생일 = birthday (plain)
생신 = birthday (honorific — used for parents, grandparents, elders). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
데려오다 = to bring someone along (plain — children, friends, pets)
모셔오다 = to bring/escort someone (humble honorific — bringing elders or superiors)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 아이를 데려올게. / 어머니를 모셔오겠습니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I'll bring the kid. / I will bring my mother. (respectful)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 데려오다 and 모셔오다: 데려오다 = to bring someone along (plain — children, friends, pets)
모셔오다 = to bring/escort someone (humble honorific — bringing elders or superiors). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
사람 = person (plain, neutral)
분 = person (honorific — respectfully referring to someone of higher status or unknown elders)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 그 사람 누구야? / 어떤 분이 찾아오셨습니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Who is that person? / A certain person (respectful) has come to see you.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 사람 and 분: 사람 = person (plain, neutral)
분 = person (honorific — respectfully referring to someone of higher status or unknown elders). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
아내 = wife (neutral, referring to one's own wife)
부인 = wife (polite, referring to someone else's wife)
사모님 = wife (very respectful honorific — addressing a teacher's or superior's wife)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 제 아내를 소개합니다. / 사장님 부인께서 오셨습니다. / 교수님, 사모님께 안부 전해 주세요.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Let me introduce my wife. / The CEO's wife has arrived. / Professor, please give my regards to your wife.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 아내 = wife (neutral, referring to one's own wife)
부인 = wife (polite, referring to someone else's wife)
사모님 = wife (very respectful honorific — addressing a teacher's or superior's wife). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
그래서 = so / therefore (casual, spoken everyday connector)
그러므로 = therefore (formal written, logical conclusion)
이에 = accordingly / thereupon (very formal, official documents and announcements)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 비가 왔어. 그래서 집에 있었어. / 증거가 불충분하다. 그러므로 무죄를 선고한다. / 이에 다음과 같이 공고합니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: It rained. So I stayed home. / The evidence is insufficient. Therefore, we declare not guilty. / Accordingly, we announce the following.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 그래서 = so / therefore (casual, spoken everyday connector)
그러므로 = therefore (formal written, logical conclusion)
이에 = accordingly / thereupon (very formal, official documents and announcements). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
근데 = but (casual spoken contraction of 그런데)
그런데 = but / however (standard, spoken and written)
허나 = however / but (literary/archaic, very formal writing or historical narration)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 근데 왜 안 왔어? / 열심히 했다. 그런데 결과가 좋지 않았다. / 허나 그의 노력은 헛되지 않았다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: But why didn't you come? / I worked hard. However, the result wasn't good. / But his efforts were not in vain.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 근데 = but (casual spoken contraction of 그런데)
그런데 = but / however (standard, spoken and written)
허나 = however / but (literary/archaic, very formal writing or historical narration). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
엄청 = super / extremely (colloquial emphasis — casual speech)
매우 = very (standard formal intensifier)
지극히 = exceedingly / supremely (literary, the utmost degree — formal writing)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 엄청 맛있다! / 매우 중요한 사안입니다. / 지극히 개인적인 의견입니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: It's super delicious! / This is a very important matter. / This is an exceedingly personal opinion.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 엄청 = super / extremely (colloquial emphasis — casual speech)
매우 = very (standard formal intensifier)
지극히 = exceedingly / supremely (literary, the utmost degree — formal writing). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
진짜 = really / for real (casual, emphatic — slang-adjacent)
정말 = really / truly (standard, neutral emphasis)
실로 = truly / indeed (literary/formal — expressing genuine awe or emphasis in writing)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 진짜야? 진짜로? / 정말 감사합니다. / 실로 놀라운 성과이다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Really? For real? / I truly thank you. / It is indeed a remarkable achievement.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 진짜 = really / for real (casual, emphatic — slang-adjacent)
정말 = really / truly (standard, neutral emphasis)
실로 = truly / indeed (literary/formal — expressing genuine awe or emphasis in writing). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
게다가 = on top of that / besides (casual, spoken addition — piling on)
더욱이 = moreover / furthermore (formal written, escalating importance)
나아가 = furthermore / going further (formal, advancing the argument to a next step)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 비도 오고 게다가 바람도 분다. / 더욱이 이번 사건은 전례가 없다. / 나아가 제도적 개선이 필요하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: It's raining and on top of that, it's windy. / Moreover, this incident is unprecedented. / Furthermore, institutional improvements are needed.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 게다가 = on top of that / besides (casual, spoken addition — piling on)
더욱이 = moreover / furthermore (formal written, escalating importance)
나아가 = furthermore / going further (formal, advancing the argument to a next step). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
그냥 = just / for no reason (casual, vague — 'just because', 'without doing anything special')
단순히 = simply / merely (formal, clarifying that something is uncomplicated or limited in scope)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 그냥 왔어. / 이것은 단순히 실수가 아니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I just came (no particular reason). / This is not simply a mistake.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 그냥 and 단순히: 그냥 = just / for no reason (casual, vague — 'just because', 'without doing anything special')
단순히 = simply / merely (formal, clarifying that something is uncomplicated or limited in scope). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
아마 = maybe / probably (casual, everyday uncertainty)
십중팔구 = in all likelihood / nine times out of ten (idiomatic, high probability — more emphatic and literary)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 아마 내일 올 거야. / 십중팔구 그가 범인일 것이다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: He'll probably come tomorrow. / In all likelihood, he is the culprit.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 아마 and 십중팔구: 아마 = maybe / probably (casual, everyday uncertainty)
십중팔구 = in all likelihood / nine times out of ten (idiomatic, high probability — more emphatic and literary). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
왜냐하면 = because / the reason is (spoken, explaining cause in conversation)
~(이)기에 = because / since (formal written, giving reason in condensed literary form)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 왜냐하면 시간이 없었으니까. / 부족하기에 더 노력해야 한다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Because I didn't have time. / Because it is lacking, we must try harder.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 왜냐하면 and ~(이)기에: 왜냐하면 = because / the reason is (spoken, explaining cause in conversation)
~(이)기에 = because / since (formal written, giving reason in condensed literary form). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
마치다 = to finish (native Korean, general — wrapping up a task or event)
완료하다 = to complete (Sino-Korean, formal — official completion with finality)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 수업을 마쳤다. / 시스템 업데이트가 완료되었습니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Finished the class. / The system update has been completed.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 마치다 and 완료하다: 마치다 = to finish (native Korean, general — wrapping up a task or event)
완료하다 = to complete (Sino-Korean, formal — official completion with finality). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
가르치다 = to teach (native Korean, direct instruction — teacher to student)
교육하다 = to educate (Sino-Korean, systematic — institutions, broader development)
훈련하다 = to train (Sino-Korean, drilling skills — military, sports, specific competencies)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 학생들에게 수학을 가르친다. / 시민 의식을 교육해야 한다. / 신입 사원을 훈련시키다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I teach math to students. / We must educate civic awareness. / Training the new employees.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 가르치다 = to teach (native Korean, direct instruction — teacher to student)
교육하다 = to educate (Sino-Korean, systematic — institutions, broader development)
훈련하다 = to train (Sino-Korean, drilling skills — military, sports, specific competencies). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
모으다 = to gather / collect (native Korean, general — money, people, things)
수집하다 = to collect (Sino-Korean, systematic — data, specimens, stamps, curated collections)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 돈을 모으고 있다. / 우표를 수집하는 취미가 있다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I'm saving up money. / I have a hobby of collecting stamps.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 모으다 and 수집하다: 모으다 = to gather / collect (native Korean, general — money, people, things)
수집하다 = to collect (Sino-Korean, systematic — data, specimens, stamps, curated collections). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
빌리다 = to borrow / lend (native Korean, casual everyday — from friends, library)
대여하다 = to rent / lease (Sino-Korean, commercial — equipment, books, formal rental)
차용하다 = to borrow (Sino-Korean, formal/financial — loans; also figurative: borrowing concepts or words)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 친구한테 우산을 빌렸다. / 장비를 대여해 드립니다. / 외국어에서 차용한 표현이다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I borrowed an umbrella from a friend. / We rent out the equipment. / It's an expression borrowed from a foreign language.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 빌리다 = to borrow / lend (native Korean, casual everyday — from friends, library)
대여하다 = to rent / lease (Sino-Korean, commercial — equipment, books, formal rental)
차용하다 = to borrow (Sino-Korean, formal/financial — loans; also figurative: borrowing concepts or words). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
고르다 = to pick / choose (native Korean, casual — selecting from options by preference)
선택하다 = to select / choose (Sino-Korean, deliberate — making a decision among alternatives)
선별하다 = to screen / sort out (Sino-Korean, filtering — selecting by criteria, quality control)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 마음에 드는 걸로 골라. / 진로를 선택해야 한다. / 우수한 인재를 선별하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Pick whichever you like. / You need to choose a career path. / Screening for outstanding talent.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 고르다 = to pick / choose (native Korean, casual — selecting from options by preference)
선택하다 = to select / choose (Sino-Korean, deliberate — making a decision among alternatives)
선별하다 = to screen / sort out (Sino-Korean, filtering — selecting by criteria, quality control). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
쌓다 = to pile up / build up (native Korean, tangible and figurative — blocks, experience, trust)
축적하다 = to accumulate (Sino-Korean, formal — wealth, knowledge, data over time)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 경험을 쌓아야 한다. / 오랜 기간 기술을 축적해 왔다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: You need to build up experience. / We have accumulated technology over a long period.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 쌓다 and 축적하다: 쌓다 = to pile up / build up (native Korean, tangible and figurative — blocks, experience, trust)
축적하다 = to accumulate (Sino-Korean, formal — wealth, knowledge, data over time). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
치르다 = to pay / undergo (native Korean — pay a price, take an exam, endure hardship; figurative cost)
지불하다 = to pay (Sino-Korean, formal/financial — monetary payment transactions)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 큰 대가를 치렀다. / 카드로 지불하시겠습니까?
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Paid a heavy price. / Would you like to pay by card?
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 치르다 and 지불하다: 치르다 = to pay / undergo (native Korean — pay a price, take an exam, endure hardship; figurative cost)
지불하다 = to pay (Sino-Korean, formal/financial — monetary payment transactions). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
이기다 = to win / beat (native Korean, casual — games, arguments, opponents)
승리하다 = to achieve victory (Sino-Korean, formal — wars, elections, grand triumphs)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 축구에서 이겼다! / 마침내 전쟁에서 승리했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: We won at soccer! / Finally achieved victory in the war.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 이기다 and 승리하다: 이기다 = to win / beat (native Korean, casual — games, arguments, opponents)
승리하다 = to achieve victory (Sino-Korean, formal — wars, elections, grand triumphs). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
지다 = to lose (native Korean, casual — games, competitions, everyday)
패배하다 = to be defeated (Sino-Korean, formal — battles, significant losses, official contexts)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 3 대 1로 졌다. / 선거에서 패배했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Lost 3 to 1. / Was defeated in the election.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 지다 and 패배하다: 지다 = to lose (native Korean, casual — games, competitions, everyday)
패배하다 = to be defeated (Sino-Korean, formal — battles, significant losses, official contexts). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
갈다 = to change / replace (native Korean, casual — swapping out worn items: tires, lightbulbs)
교체하다 = to replace (Sino-Korean, formal/official — personnel, equipment, systematic replacement)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 타이어를 갈아야 해. / 노후 장비를 교체할 예정이다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I need to change the tires. / We plan to replace the aging equipment.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Compare 갈다 and 교체하다: 갈다 = to change / replace (native Korean, casual — swapping out worn items: tires, lightbulbs)
교체하다 = to replace (Sino-Korean, formal/official — personnel, equipment, systematic replacement). See example for context difference.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
좋아하다 = to like (general positive feeling — food, people, activities)
사랑하다 = to love (deep emotional bond — romantic, familial, passionate)
흠모하다 = to admire / adore (reverent admiration from afar — literary, one-sided deep respect)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 초콜릿을 좋아한다. / 가족을 사랑한다. / 오래전부터 그분을 흠모해 왔다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I like chocolate. / I love my family. / I have long admired that person from afar.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 좋아하다 = to like (general positive feeling — food, people, activities)
사랑하다 = to love (deep emotional bond — romantic, familial, passionate)
흠모하다 = to admire / adore (reverent admiration from afar — literary, one-sided deep respect). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
미안하다 = sorry (casual, everyday apology — among friends and equals)
죄송하다 = sorry (polite, standard formal apology — to superiors, strangers)
송구하다 = deeply sorry / ashamed (most formal, profound regret — public apologies, to high authority)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 미안, 늦었어. / 불편을 끼쳐 죄송합니다. / 이런 결과를 초래하여 송구합니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Sorry, I'm late. / I'm sorry for the inconvenience. / I am deeply sorry for causing this result.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).notes:
Nuance difference in: 미안하다 = sorry (casual, everyday apology — among friends and equals)
죄송하다 = sorry (polite, standard formal apology — to superiors, strangers)
송구하다 = deeply sorry / ashamed (most formal, profound regret — public apologies, to high authority). Use in appropriate register.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
싫다 = to dislike / not want (basic negative preference — mild to moderate)
혐오하다 = to loathe / detest (strong moral or visceral disgust — formal)
질색하다 = to be utterly repulsed / can't stand (emphatic revulsion — instinctive recoil)

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Like talking to a wall (lit. 'reading sutras to a cow's ear')

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (自業自得): You reap what you sow (lit. 'your own doing, your own reward'). Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (自暴自棄): To give up on oneself; to abandon all hope. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 동(同) together + 고(苦) suffering + 동(同) together + 락(樂) joy/pleasure
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: They're colleagues who shared joys and sorrows for 10 years.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (同苦同樂): Sharing joys and sorrows together. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (有備無患): Preparedness prevents disaster. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (轉禍爲福): Turning misfortune into fortune; a blessing in disguise. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (同床異夢): Same bed, different dreams (outwardly together but thinking differently). Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (以心傳心): Heart-to-heart understanding; unspoken mutual understanding. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (苦盡甘來): After hardship comes sweetness; no pain, no gain. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Unforgettable gratitude; deeply engraved in one's bones
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 각(刻) carve + 골(骨) bone + 난(難) difficult + 망(忘) forget
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: My benefactor's help is something I can never forget.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (刻骨難忘): Unforgettable gratitude; deeply engraved in one's bones. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: The more the better
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 다(多) many + 다(多) many + 익(益) benefit + 선(善) good
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: When it comes to experience, the more the better.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A ragtag group; disorganized mob
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 오(烏) crow + 합(合) gather + 지(之) 's (possessive) + 졸(卒) soldiers

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Lost in fog; completely in the dark
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 오(五) five + 리(里) ri (distance unit) + 무(霧) fog + 중(中) middle
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The truth of the case is still completely in the dark.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (五里霧中): Lost in fog; completely in the dark. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Can't sit still; on pins and needles
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 좌(坐) sit + 불(不) not + 안(安) comfortable + 석(席) seat
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Waiting for the results, I was on pins and needles.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 부(附) attach + 화(和) harmonize + 뇌(雷) thunder + 동(同) same
