사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: From stories of scholars too poor for candles — one read by firefly light, another by snow's reflection

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Fellow sufferers sympathize with each other; misery loves company
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 동(同) same + 병(病) illness + 상(相) mutually + 련(憐) pity/sympathize
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Since we were in the same situation, I helped out of fellow feeling.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (同病相憐): Fellow sufferers sympathize with each other; misery loves company. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Too much is as bad as too little; excess is just as wrong as deficiency
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 과(過) exceed + 유(猶) still/as if + 불(不) not + 급(及) reach
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Even exercise follows the rule of moderation. Overdoing it ruins your body.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (過猶不及): Too much is as bad as too little; excess is just as wrong as deficiency. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Icing on the cake; adding flowers to brocade
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 금(錦) brocade/silk + 상(上) on top + 첨(添) add + 화(花) flower
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: A promotion plus a bonus — icing on the cake.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (錦上添花): Icing on the cake; adding flowers to brocade. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Surrounded on all sides by enemies; desperate situation with no allies
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 사(四) four + 면(面) sides + 초(楚) Chu (kingdom) + 가(歌) song
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 여론도 등을 돌리면서 대통령은 사면초가에 빠졌다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: With public opinion also turning against him, the president found himself besieged on all sides.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (四面楚歌): Surrounded on all sides by enemies; desperate situation with no allies. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Adding frost on top of snow; to make matters worse
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 설(雪) snow + 상(上) on top + 가(加) add + 상(霜) frost
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: On top of losing my job, to make matters worse, my health deteriorated.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (雪上加霜): Adding frost on top of snow; to make matters worse. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Standing by idly; watching with folded arms
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 수(袖) sleeve + 수(手) hand + 방(傍) beside + 관(觀) watch
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: If you stand by idly watching injustice, you're no different from an accomplice.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (袖手傍觀): Standing by idly; watching with folded arms. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: State of ecstasy; being completely absorbed; selfless trance
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 무(無) without + 아(我) self + 지(之) 's + 경(境) state/realm
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I was so absorbed in the music that I entered a state of ecstasy.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (無我之境): State of ecstasy; being completely absorbed; selfless trance. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Clear autumn skies (lit. 'sky is high, horses are fat') — the beauty of autumn
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 천(天) sky/heaven + 고(高) high + 마(馬) horse + 비(肥) fat/plump
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The season of high skies and plump horses — autumn has arrived.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (天高馬肥): Clear autumn skies (lit. 'sky is high, horses are fat') — the beauty of autumn. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Deceiving with surface changes while the substance stays the same; a swindle
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 조(朝) morning + 삼(三) three + 모(暮) evening + 사(四) four
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: A policy with only its name changed is nothing more than a shell game.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (朝三暮四): Deceiving with surface changes while the substance stays the same; a swindle. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Visiting three times to recruit talent; persistent and sincere effort to win someone over
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 삼(三) three + 고(顧) look back/visit + 초(草) grass/thatched + 려(廬) hut
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 인재를 영입하기 위해 삼고초려의 노력을 기울였다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: They made every effort, like visiting the thatched hut three times, to recruit that talent.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (三顧草廬): Visiting three times to recruit talent; persistent and sincere effort to win someone over. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Enduring hardships for the sake of future revenge/success; sleeping on firewood and tasting gall
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 와(臥) lie down + 신(薪) firewood + 상(嘗) taste + 담(膽) gallbladder
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I'm preparing my comeback with the determination of enduring any hardship.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (臥薪嘗膽): Enduring hardships for the sake of future revenge/success; sleeping on firewood and tasting gall. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Speaking with one voice; unanimous agreement
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 이(異) different + 구(口) mouth + 동(同) same + 성(聲) voice
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 모든 전문가가 이구동성으로 개혁이 필요하다고 말했다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: All experts unanimously said that reform is needed.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (異口同聲): Speaking with one voice; unanimous agreement. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Adapting to the situation; thinking on one's feet
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 임(臨) face/approach + 기(機) opportunity/moment + 응(應) respond + 변(變) change
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I dealt with the unexpected situation by thinking on my feet.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (臨機應變): Adapting to the situation; thinking on one's feet. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Snatching life from the jaws of death; a miraculous recovery
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 기(起) rise + 사(死) death + 회(回) return + 생(生) life
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: They snatched victory from defeat with a dramatic goal in the second half.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (起死回生): Snatching life from the jaws of death; a miraculous recovery. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Worrying oneself sick; burning with anxiety
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 노(勞) labor + 심(心) heart + 초(焦) scorch + 사(思) thought
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Parents worry themselves sick over their children.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (勞心焦思): Worrying oneself sick; burning with anxiety. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Living at ease; leisurely and carefree
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 유(悠) leisurely + 유(悠) leisurely + 자(自) self + 적(適) comfortable/suitable
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 은퇴 후 시골에서 유유자적한 삶을 보내고 있다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: After retirement, I'm living a leisurely life in the countryside.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (悠悠自適): Living at ease; leisurely and carefree. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Rewarding good and punishing evil
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 권(勸) encourage + 선(善) good + 징(懲) punish + 악(惡) evil
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Traditional fairy tales contain the lesson of rewarding good and punishing evil.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (勸善懲惡): Rewarding good and punishing evil. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Never forgetting, asleep or awake; constantly thinking of something/someone
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 오(寤) awake + 매(寐) asleep + 불(不) not + 망(忘) forget
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I long for my hometown day and night, never forgetting.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (寤寐不忘): Never forgetting, asleep or awake; constantly thinking of something/someone. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Swallowing the bitter and giving away the sweet — self-sacrifice (esp. by parents)
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 감(甘) sweet + 탄(呑) swallow + 고(苦) bitter + 토(吐) spit out
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The mother lived her life swallowing the sweet and spitting out the bitter for her children.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: The parent swallows the bitter (hardship) themselves and gives the sweet (good things) to their children.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Scared out of one's wits; soul scattered in terror
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 혼(魂) soul + 비(飛) fly + 백(魄) spirit + 산(散) scatter
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I was scared out of my wits when a sudden explosion was heard.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (魂飛魄散): Scared out of one's wits; soul scattered in terror. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: The student surpasses the master; blue comes from indigo but is bluer
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 청(靑) blue/green + 출(出) come out + 어(於) from + 람(藍) indigo
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: For the disciple to surpass the master — the student has outshone the teacher.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (靑出於藍): The student surpasses the master; blue comes from indigo but is bluer. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A narrow escape from death; surviving against all odds (nine deaths, one life)
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 구(九) nine + 사(死) death + 일(一) one + 생(生) life
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I barely survived the landslide by the narrowest of margins.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (九死一生): A narrow escape from death; surviving against all odds (nine deaths, one life). Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Caught between a rock and a hard place; can neither advance nor retreat
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 진(進) advance + 퇴(退) retreat + 양(兩) both + 난(難) difficult
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 사업을 계속하자니 적자고, 그만두자니 투자금이 아까워 진퇴양난이다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Continuing the business means losses, but quitting means wasting the investment — I'm caught between a rock and a hard place.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (進退兩難): Caught between a rock and a hard place; can neither advance nor retreat. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: To make a comeback; to rally after defeat
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 권(捲) roll up + 토(土) earth/dust + 중(重) again + 래(來) come
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: We failed, but we're looking for a chance to make a comeback.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (捲土重來): To make a comeback; to rally after defeat. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Stubbornly clinging to outdated methods (lit. 'carving a mark on the boat to find a dropped sword')
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 각(刻) carve + 주(舟) boat + 구(求) seek + 검(劍) sword
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 시대가 변했는데 아직도 각주구검식으로 하면 안 된다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Times have changed — you can't keep doing it the old way.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: From a story about a man who dropped his sword from a boat, carved a mark on the hull, and tried to find it at that spot after the boat moved

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Every shot hits the mark; unerring accuracy
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 백(百) hundred + 발(發) shoot + 백(百) hundred + 중(中) hit
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That player hits every free throw without fail.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (百發百中): Every shot hits the mark; unerring accuracy. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Great talents mature late; a late bloomer
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 대(大) great + 기(器) vessel + 만(晩) late + 성(成) achieve
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: As they say, great talents mature late — he finally succeeded in his fifties.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (大器晩成): Great talents mature late; a late bloomer. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A bosom friend; an inseparable companion
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 막(莫) none + 역(逆) go against + 지(之) 's + 우(友) friend
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: We have been the closest of friends since childhood.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (莫逆之友): A bosom friend; an inseparable companion. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A clear mirror and still water; a calm and unclouded mind
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 명(明) bright + 경(鏡) mirror + 지(止) still + 수(水) water
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: You must judge with a calm and unclouded mind.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (明鏡止水): A clear mirror and still water; a calm and unclouded mind. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Karmic retribution; every action has its consequence
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 인(因) cause + 과(果) result + 응(應) respond + 보(報) repay
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 나쁜 짓을 하면 인과응보를 받는 법이다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: If you do bad things, karmic retribution will catch up with you.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (因果應報): Karmic retribution; every action has its consequence. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A negative example; someone whose mistakes teach you what not to do
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 반(反) opposite + 면(面) face/side + 교(教) teach + 사(師) teacher
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I took his failure as a lesson in what not to do.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (反面教師): A negative example; someone whose mistakes teach you what not to do. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Running around in confusion; not knowing which way to turn
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 우(右) right + 왕(往) go + 좌(左) left + 왕(往) go
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: People ran around in confusion during the emergency.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (右往左往): Running around in confusion; not knowing which way to turn. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: The whole story from beginning to end
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 자(自) from + 초(初) beginning + 지(至) to + 종(終) end
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Please explain the whole story from beginning to end.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (自初至終): The whole story from beginning to end. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Careful and thorough deliberation; deep consideration
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 심(深) deep + 사(思) think + 숙(熟) mature/ripe + 고(考) consider
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: After careful deliberation, I decided to change jobs.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (深思熟考): Careful and thorough deliberation; deep consideration. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Making rapid progress day by day and month by month
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(日) day + 취(就) accomplish + 월(月) month + 장(將) advance
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: His Korean skills are improving by leaps and bounds.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (日就月將): Making rapid progress day by day and month by month. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Running about busily in all directions
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 동(東) east + 분(奔) run + 서(西) west + 주(走) dash
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I'm exhausted from running around in all directions preparing for the event.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (東奔西走): Running about busily in all directions. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Self-praise; blowing one's own trumpet
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 자(自) self + 화(畫) paint/draw + 자(自) self + 찬(讚) praise
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: There's a limit to how much you should praise yourself.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (自畫自讚): Self-praise; blowing one's own trumpet. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Matching words with actions; practicing what one preaches
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 언(言) words + 행(行) actions + 일(一) one + 치(致) reach/arrive
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: If you are a leader, it is important to practice what you preach.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (言行一致): Matching words with actions; practicing what one preaches. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Unprecedented and unrepeatable; one of a kind
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 전(前) before + 무(無) without + 후(後) after + 무(無) without
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That is an unprecedented and unrepeatable record in history.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (前無後無): Unprecedented and unrepeatable; one of a kind. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Fighting a lonely battle; struggling alone against the odds
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 고(孤) solitary + 군(軍) army + 분(奮) exert + 투(鬪) fight
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Don't struggle alone — ask for help.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (孤軍奮鬪): Fighting a lonely battle; struggling alone against the odds. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Charging recklessly in all directions; dashing about without a plan
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 좌(左) left + 충(衝) charge + 우(右) right + 돌(突) rush
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: He grew his business by charging ahead recklessly in every direction.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (左衝右突): Charging recklessly in all directions; dashing about without a plan. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Repaying kindness with ingratitude; biting the hand that feeds you
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 배(背) turn one's back + 은(恩) grace + 망(忘) forget + 덕(德) virtue
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I helped them, but they turned out to be an ungrateful person.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (背恩忘德): Repaying kindness with ingratitude; biting the hand that feeds you. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A life-or-death decision; risking everything
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 사(死) death + 생(生) life + 결(決) decide + 단(斷) sever/judge
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I entered the match with a do-or-die determination.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (死生決斷): A life-or-death decision; risking everything. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Helpless; unable to do anything; with hands tied
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 속(束) bind + 수(手) hands + 무(無) without + 책(策) plan
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: We were helpless in the face of the sudden disaster.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (束手無策): Helpless; unable to do anything; with hands tied. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Progressing at lightning speed; advancing a thousand miles at once
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(一) one + 사(瀉) pour + 천(千) thousand + 리(里) ri (distance)
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The negotiations progressed at lightning speed.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (一瀉千里): Progressing at lightning speed; advancing a thousand miles at once. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A candle flickering in the wind; a precarious situation
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 풍(風) wind + 전(前) before + 등(燈) lamp + 화(火) fire
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The company's survival hangs in the balance like a candle in the wind.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (風前燈火): A candle flickering in the wind; a precarious situation. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: The fisherman's gain; profiting from others' conflict
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 어(漁) fish + 부(夫) man + 지(之) 's + 리(利) profit
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 두 회사가 싸우는 사이에 어부지리로 이익을 챙겼다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: While the two companies fought, a third party profited from the conflict.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (漁夫之利): The fisherman's gain; profiting from others' conflict. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: The guilty party acting indignant; the thief wielding the stick
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 적(賊) thief + 반(反) instead + 하(荷) carry + 장(杖) stick
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 잘못해 놓고 오히려 화를 내다니 적반하장이다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Making a mistake and then getting angry about it — that's the pot calling the kettle black.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (賊反荷杖): The guilty party acting indignant; the thief wielding the stick. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Sweet talk; honeyed words used to deceive
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 감(甘) sweet + 언(言) words + 이(利) profitable + 설(說) speech
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Don't be fooled by honeyed words.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (甘言利說): Sweet talk; honeyed words used to deceive. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Wholehearted devotion; single-minded loyalty
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(一) one + 편(片) piece + 단(丹) red/sincere + 심(心) heart
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I will live with wholehearted devotion to my country.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (一片丹心): Wholehearted devotion; single-minded loyalty. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A once-in-a-thousand-years opportunity; an extremely rare chance
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 천(千) thousand + 재(載) years + 일(一) one + 우(遇) encounter
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity, so don't let it slip away.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (千載一遇): A once-in-a-thousand-years opportunity; an extremely rare chance. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Catching everything in one net; a complete roundup
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(一) one + 망(網) net + 타(打) strike + 진(盡) exhaust/all
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The police rounded up the entire criminal organization in one sweep.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (一網打盡): Catching everything in one net; a complete roundup. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A lone wolf; someone who insists on doing everything alone
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 독(獨) alone + 불(不) not + 장(將) general + 군(軍) army
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: If you act like a lone wolf, teamwork falls apart.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (獨不將軍): A lone wolf; someone who insists on doing everything alone. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Gaining two things with one action; double benefit from a single effort
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(一) one + 거(擧) raise/act + 양(兩) two + 득(得) gain
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 재활용하면 환경도 지키고 비용도 줄이고 일거양득이다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Recycling protects the environment and reduces costs — a double benefit.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (一擧兩得): Gaining two things with one action; double benefit from a single effort. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Gratitude beyond death; a debt of kindness one can never forget
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 백(白) white + 골(骨) bone + 난(難) difficult + 망(忘) forget
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The kindness of saving my life is a debt I can never repay, even in death.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (白骨難忘): Gratitude beyond death; a debt of kindness one can never forget. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Foresight; the wisdom to see things before they happen
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 선(先) ahead + 견(見) see + 지(之) of + 명(明) clarity
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 투자자는 선견지명이 있어서 시장이 폭락하기 전에 주식을 팔았다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That investor had the foresight to sell stocks before the market crashed.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (先見之明): Foresight; the wisdom to see things before they happen. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Know your enemy and know yourself; key to victory
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 지(知) know + 피(彼) the other + 지(知) know + 기(己) oneself
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 지피지기면 백전백승이라고, 협상 전에 상대방을 철저히 분석해야 한다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: As they say, know your enemy and yourself and you'll win every battle — you must thoroughly analyze the other side before negotiations.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (知彼知己): Know your enemy and know yourself; key to victory. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Befriend the distant and attack the near; a divide-and-conquer strategy
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 원(遠) far + 교(交) befriend + 근(近) near + 공(攻) attack
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 기업은 원교근공 전략으로 해외 파트너와 손잡고 국내 경쟁사를 압박했다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The company used a distant-ally strategy, partnering with overseas firms to pressure domestic competitors.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (遠交近攻): Befriend the distant and attack the near; a divide-and-conquer strategy. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Watching and waiting like a tiger; eyeing an opportunity
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 호(虎) tiger + 시(視) gaze + 탐(眈) glare + 탐(眈) glare
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 경쟁 업체들이 호시탐탐 우리 시장 점유율을 노리고 있다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Competing companies are watching like tigers, eyeing our market share.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (虎視眈眈): Watching and waiting like a tiger; eyeing an opportunity. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Making an empty show of force; bluffing
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 허(虛) empty + 장(張) spread + 성(聲) voice + 세(勢) power
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그의 강경한 발언은 허장성세에 불과했고, 실제로는 양보할 준비가 되어 있었다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: His tough talk was nothing but bluffing — he was actually ready to make concessions.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (虛張聲勢): Making an empty show of force; bluffing. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Use one's adversary to control another; divide and rule
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 이(以) use + 이(夷) outsider + 제(制) control + 이(夷) outsider
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 정치인은 이이제이 전략으로 반대파 내부의 분열을 유도했다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The politician used a divide-and-rule strategy to provoke infighting within the opposition.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (以夷制夷): Use one's adversary to control another; divide and rule. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Groping in the dark; searching blindly for a solution
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 암(暗) dark + 중(中) middle + 모(摸) feel + 색(索) search
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 증거가 부족해서 수사관들은 암중모색하며 단서를 찾고 있었다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: With insufficient evidence, the investigators were groping in the dark for clues.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (暗中摸索): Groping in the dark; searching blindly for a solution. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: When the lips are gone, the teeth feel cold; mutual dependence
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 순(脣) lips + 망(亡) perish + 치(齒) teeth + 한(寒) cold
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 두 나라는 순망치한의 관계라 한쪽이 무너지면 다른 쪽도 위험하다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The two countries are so interdependent that if one falls, the other is at risk.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (脣亡齒寒): When the lips are gone, the teeth feel cold; mutual dependence. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A friendship of deep trust and understanding, like Guan Zhong and Bao Shuya
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 관(管) Guan Zhong + 포(鮑) Bao Shuya + 지(之) of + 교(交) friendship
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 우리 둘은 관포지교라 서로 잘못을 해도 이해하고 감싸 준다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Our friendship is so deep that we forgive and embrace each other even when we make mistakes.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (管鮑之交): A friendship of deep trust and understanding, like Guan Zhong and Bao Shuya. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: An inseparable bond, like water and fish
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 수(水) water + 어(魚) fish + 지(之) of + 교(交) friendship
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 유비와 제갈량은 수어지교의 관계로 서로 없이는 큰일을 이룰 수 없었다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Liu Bei and Zhuge Liang had an inseparable bond — neither could accomplish great things without the other.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (水魚之交): An inseparable bond, like water and fish. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Partings and reunions; the cycle of coming together and breaking apart
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 이(離) separate + 합(合) unite + 집(集) gather + 산(散) scatter
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 정치판에서는 이합집산이 반복되어 어제의 적이 오늘의 동지가 된다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: In politics, alliances constantly form and dissolve, so yesterday's enemy becomes today's ally.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (離合集散): Partings and reunions; the cycle of coming together and breaking apart. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Repaying a debt of gratitude, even after death
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 결(結) tie + 초(草) grass + 보(報) repay + 은(恩) kindness
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 스승의 은혜에 결초보은하는 마음으로 장학금을 기부했다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: With a heart determined to repay my teacher's kindness, I donated a scholarship.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (結草報恩): Repaying a debt of gratitude, even after death. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Growing old together for a hundred years; lifelong marital devotion
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 백(百) hundred + 년(年) years + 해(偕) together + 로(老) grow old
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 할아버지와 할머니는 백년해로하시며 서로를 한결같이 아껴 오셨다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: My grandparents have grown old together, cherishing each other faithfully throughout their lives.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (百年偕老): Growing old together for a hundred years; lifelong marital devotion. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Mutual help and support; assisting one another
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 상(相) mutually + 부(扶) support + 상(相) mutually + 조(助) help
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 이웃 간에 상부상조하는 문화가 점점 사라지고 있어 안타깝다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: It's regrettable that the culture of neighbors helping each other is gradually disappearing.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (相扶相助): Mutual help and support; assisting one another. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A blessing in disguise; fortune and misfortune are unpredictable
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 새(塞) frontier + 옹(翁) old man + 지(之) of + 마(馬) horse
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 해고를 당했지만 새옹지마라고, 덕분에 더 좋은 직장을 찾게 되었다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I was laid off, but as they say, misfortune can turn to fortune — I ended up finding a better job.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (塞翁之馬): A blessing in disguise; fortune and misfortune are unpredictable. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: All things are impermanent; nothing lasts forever
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 제(諸) all + 행(行) phenomena + 무(無) without + 상(常) permanence
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 제행무상이라는 말처럼, 아무리 강한 제국도 결국 멸망한다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: As the saying goes, all things are impermanent — even the mightiest empire eventually falls.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (諸行無常): All things are impermanent; nothing lasts forever. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Form is emptiness; material things are inherently empty
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 색(色) form + 즉(即) is + 시(是) this + 공(空) emptiness
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 재산을 잃고 나서야 색즉시공이라는 말의 의미를 깨달았다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Only after losing my wealth did I grasp the meaning of 'form is emptiness.'
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (色即是空): Form is emptiness; material things are inherently empty. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Largely the same with minor differences
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 대(大) large + 동(同) same + 소(小) small + 이(異) different
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 두 후보의 공약은 대동소이해서 유권자들이 선택하기 어려웠다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The two candidates' platforms were largely the same, making it difficult for voters to choose.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (大同小異): Largely the same with minor differences. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A mix of truth and bluff; feinting and real moves intertwined
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 허(虛) empty + 허(虛) empty + 실(實) real + 실(實) real
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 협상 테이블에서 양측은 허허실실 전략을 구사하며 서로의 속내를 탐색했다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: At the negotiating table, both sides employed a mix of bluffs and real moves, probing each other's true intentions.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (虛虛實實): A mix of truth and bluff; feinting and real moves intertwined. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: I alone am supreme; extreme arrogance or self-importance
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 유(唯) only + 아(我) I + 독(獨) alone + 존(尊) revered
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그는 유아독존 식으로 행동해서 팀원들의 반감을 샀다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: He acted as if he alone mattered, earning resentment from his teammates.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (唯我獨尊): I alone am supreme; extreme arrogance or self-importance. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: All things flow and change; everything is in constant flux
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 만(萬) ten thousand + 물(物) things + 유(流) flow + 전(轉) turn
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 만물유전의 이치를 받아들이면 변화에 대한 두려움이 줄어든다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: If you accept that all things flow and change, your fear of change diminishes.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (萬物流轉): All things flow and change; everything is in constant flux. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Hanging a sheep's head but selling dog meat; false advertising
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 양(羊) sheep + 두(頭) head + 구(狗) dog + 육(肉) meat
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 친환경이라고 광고하면서 유해 물질을 쓰다니, 양두구육도 이런 양두구육이 없다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Advertising as eco-friendly while using harmful substances — there's no better example of false advertising.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (羊頭狗肉): Hanging a sheep's head but selling dog meat; false advertising. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A cunning rabbit has three burrows; always have backup plans
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 교(狡) cunning + 토(兔) rabbit + 삼(三) three + 굴(窟) burrow
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 사업가는 교토삼굴이라고 여러 나라에 자산을 분산해 두었다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That businessman, like a cunning rabbit with three burrows, spread his assets across multiple countries.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (狡兔三窟): A cunning rabbit has three burrows; always have backup plans. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Honey on the lips but a sword in the belly; outwardly sweet but inwardly treacherous
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 구(口) mouth + 밀(蜜) honey + 복(腹) belly + 검(劍) sword
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 사람은 구밀복검이라 겉으로는 친절하지만 뒤에서는 험담을 한다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That person is honey-mouthed but dagger-hearted — kind on the surface but gossiping behind your back.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (口蜜腹劍): Honey on the lips but a sword in the belly; outwardly sweet but inwardly treacherous. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Good medicine tastes bitter; honest advice is hard to hear
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 양(良) good + 약(藥) medicine + 고(苦) bitter + 구(口) mouth
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 양약고구라고, 부모님의 잔소리가 결국 나를 바른길로 이끌었다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: As they say, good medicine tastes bitter — my parents' nagging ultimately led me down the right path.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (良藥苦口): Good medicine tastes bitter; honest advice is hard to hear. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Words that don't hold up; a nonsensical or absurd argument
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 어(語) words + 불(不) not + 성(成) become + 설(說) theory
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Cutting the budget while demanding better results — that's utterly absurd.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (語不成說): Words that don't hold up; a nonsensical or absurd argument. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Binding oneself with one's own rope; getting trapped by one's own actions
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 자(自) self + 승(繩) rope + 자(自) self + 박(縛) bind
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 거짓말을 하다 보니 자승자박이 되어 스스로 모순에 빠졌다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: By piling up lies, he trapped himself in his own contradictions.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (自繩自縛): Binding oneself with one's own rope; getting trapped by one's own actions. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Drawing water to one's own rice paddy; a self-serving interpretation
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 아(我) my + 전(田) field + 인(引) draw + 수(水) water
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 같은 자료를 놓고 서로 아전인수 격으로 유리하게 해석하고 있다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Both sides are interpreting the same data in self-serving ways to suit their own arguments.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (我田引水): Drawing water to one's own rice paddy; a self-serving interpretation. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Overcome selfish desires and return to propriety; self-discipline
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 극(克) overcome + 기(己) self + 복(復) return + 례(禮) propriety
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Confucius taught that overcoming the self and returning to propriety is the essence of benevolence.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (克己復禮): Overcome selfish desires and return to propriety; self-discipline. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Firm patience that cannot be uprooted; steadfast perseverance
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 견(堅) firm + 인(忍) endure + 불(不) not + 발(拔) pull out
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그녀는 견인불발의 자세로 10년간 연구에 매진한 끝에 성과를 냈다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: With steadfast perseverance, she devoted herself to research for ten years and finally achieved results.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (堅忍不拔): Firm patience that cannot be uprooted; steadfast perseverance. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Unity of knowledge and action; practicing what you know
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 지(知) know + 행(行) act + 합(合) unite + 일(一) one
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 환경 보호를 말하면서 일회용품을 쓴다면 지행합일이 아니다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: If you talk about protecting the environment while using disposable products, you're not practicing what you preach.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (知行合一): Unity of knowledge and action; practicing what you know. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Cutting, filing, carving, and polishing; refining oneself through diligent effort
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 절(切) cut + 차(磋) file + 탁(琢) carve + 마(磨) polish
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: I honed my skills through mutual refinement with my colleagues.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (切磋琢磨): Cutting, filing, carving, and polishing; refining oneself through diligent effort. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Diligence and frugality; working hard and spending wisely
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 근(勤) diligent + 검(儉) frugal + 절(節) moderate + 약(約) economize
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 조부모님 세대는 근검절약을 미덕으로 여기며 살아오셨다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Our grandparents' generation lived by the virtue of diligence and frugality.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (勤儉節約): Diligence and frugality; working hard and spending wisely. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Clean and incorruptible; moral integrity and honesty
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 청(清) pure + 렴(廉) incorrupt + 결(潔) clean + 백(白) white
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 판사는 청렴결백하기로 유명해서 누구도 뇌물을 시도하지 못했다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The judge was so well-known for integrity that no one even attempted a bribe.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (清廉潔白): Clean and incorruptible; moral integrity and honesty. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: When you see profit, think of righteousness; putting ethics before gain
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 견(見) see + 리(利) profit + 사(思) think + 의(義) righteousness
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 기업인이라면 견리사의의 자세로 이익 앞에서도 도의를 먼저 생각해야 한다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: A businessperson should adopt the mindset of thinking of righteousness when faced with profit.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Classical idiom (見利思義): When you see profit, think of righteousness; putting ethics before gain. Common in formal contexts, literature, proverbs.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).notes: Common idiom/fixed expression. Literal translation won't work: Things keep getting harder (lit. 'the further you go, the bigger the mountain'). Colloquial usage.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).notes: Common idiom/fixed expression. Literal translation won't work: To be arrogant/snobbish (lit. 'high nose'). Colloquial usage.
